JobFullDesc:
uShip has a unique opportunity to support its product team across multiple products with advanced data science and analytical techniques.  The primary focus of the data analyst will be to develop reliable pricing models for transporting large or bulky goods throughout the US and Canada.  The data analyst will interface with a number of departments and the executive team while advancing our strategic initiatives in a highly competitive marketplace and for our B2B products and services.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES


Work with primary stakeholders to understand project requirements
Gather data from internal and external sources
Work closely with data architecture and analyst teams
Generate reliable pricing models that may be integrated within the uShip product
Create testing pipelines that evaluate the effectiveness of the model output
Iterate on models to optimize performance
Regularly present findings to stakeholders and executive team
Work with product and development teams to integrate models
Work within the AWS ecosystem to house data, train, and deploy models
Continuously research and update skillset

REQUIREMENTS


Strong SQL skills
Competency at creating reliable data pipelines
Fluent in at least one object-oriented programming language (e.g. Python, Java, Scala or R)
Solid understanding of Statistics, A/B testing, hypothesis testing
Strong understanding of machine learning concepts and algorithms (Supervised/Unsupervised, classification/regression, etc.)
Advanced ability to perform exploratory data analysis, outlier detection, data cleaning, feature engineering
Ability to understand the output of complex algorithms and communicate to relevant parties
Basic understanding of APIs and how to host machine learning models
Iterate on models rapidly to optimize team performance and revenue
Work closely with operations leaders to jointly own daily, weekly, and monthly profitability reports
Willingness to proactively solve problems through non-conventional methods or approaches
Entrepreneurial spirit, eager to work closely with front line operations teams, their customers, and 3rd parties  

PREFERRED


Experience with geographical data
Experience with Time Series analysis
Familiarity with major commerce routes or freight lanes
Economic analysis of impacts of promotional pricing
Undergraduate degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or other relevant field

WHY USHIP?uShip offers big-company benefits in a small-ish sized company because we really value and are committed to our people. There are even some extras that will surprise you.


100% Paid Health and Dental available
401(k) matching with no vesting
Stock Options
100% paid maternity and paternity leave
uShip shipping credit ($750)
Pet Insurance
Monthly Wellness Reimbursements
Casual dress code
Dog-friendly 
So much more!
Skills: a/b testing, object oriented design, Sql
